body: $ZIM I bought more today. Q3 ER looked solid. YTD the company has generated over $4.2BN in net income and yet has a market cap of $3.2BN. I know freight is normalizing and they won't be able to charge the exorbitant fees they collected in 2021
created_at: but at the same time this company has a PE ratio that's less than half of shipping industry peers. I guess I'll keep adding and collecting dividends until the panic sellers are finished.  https://investors.zim.com/news/news-details/2022/ZIM-Reports-Financial-Results-for-the-Third-Quarter-and-First-Nine-Months-of-2022/default.aspx
